intro: Hemsleya pengxianensis, commonly known as the Pengxian lily, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as mountain forests. It has strap-like leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
